channel.title: Help?

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“moparscape4lifez, post:8, topic:231747”][quote author=nueb35 link=topic=305263.msg2446466#msg2446466 date=1221766675]

What have you done so far?

Use math.random() and then something that checks the number…

if (cock == 1) {
System.out.println(“Oh it’s Nice”);
}
else if (cock ==2) {
System.out.println(“Oh it’s Hard”);
… etc etc …
} else {
System.out.println(“No cock”);
}

many ifs :o

String[] cock = {"Big cock", "Little cock", "No cock"}; System.out.println("You, " + cock[new Random().nextInt(cock.length)]);
[/quote]

yah thats the same winterlove servers were coded with string arrays for random items and you guys saying they fail LOL… its a pretty good basee. I’ve did research and a thread for every client is considered the best way to build a server… otherwise if you depend on looping every player to process packets and if one player decides to go on a franzy spamming packets… everyone will suffer the lag… because his packets will slow down the packet processing worldwide sure you could kill the packet spammers of by timers and but there will never be any good timing for that… because no matter what if a spammer keeps coming back (not banned ip or name atm). he will cause little lag everytime and it will still piss peoples off[/quote]

Quoted for archival. Someone please shut this faggot up.

Read full topic

Thanks
[/quote]i hope you seriously didnt just use magmas piece of shit code

it gets the job done so why make things more complicated? it isn’t as if 5 if statements slow down the program.

You really are stupid, aren’t you.

So far the only one in this topic I have see post the correct answer is Neub.

I knew someone would say that. Give a fucking reason why it matters.

If only you knew how stupid you were.
Anyway, it is idiotic, learn to name your variables, learn to use an array, do you really need to create a BufferedReader for reading input? It’s a waste of memory, use something like java.io.Console which is static.

I wrote the if statements and the random number thing, not the rest of the code. Blame zammyking or whatever. If he wants to use arrays, he can go ahead and learn it himself because I’m not doing it for him.[/quote]ASHUTP URFNK DMU

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:9, topic:231747”]No offense moparscape4lifez, but you are going to get flamed heavily for making that post (unless of course, this post causes the people who usually flame to prove me wrong and not, but I doubt such things will happen). Thread per client connection is a horrible way of designing a server.

Also, you have nearly completely derailed this topic, as it has nothing to do with winterlove or server threading.[/quote]
Use a threadpool. 3 or 4 threads that loop through the connections.

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

here is what i got so far…

[code]
import java.io.*;

public class Call {

static BufferedReader keyboard = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(
		System.in), 1);

public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
System.out.println("Hello, What is your name ?");
String Name = keyboard.readLine();
System.out.println("Nice to meet you " + Name);
System.out.println("How is the weather ?");
String HowWeather = keyboard.readLine();
System.out.println("Oh it's " + HowWeather);


System.out.println("Oh it's Nice Here");
System.out.println("Oh it's Cold Here");
System.out.println("Oh it's Raining Here");
System.out.println("Oh it's Hot Here");
}

}[/code]
but see i left a big space in between because i don’t know how to make it so that it randomizes it and says only one instead of all of em.
